title: WCAS PSYCH 314-0-20 Special Topics in Psychology

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: In this seminar we will examine the nature of the mind from both Buddhist and traditional Western psychological perspectives. We will employ a Buddhist technique for investigating mental activity by incorporating a brief meditation period into class and homework activities. We will also examine written materials from both traditions, and these will form the primary basis for class discussion and examinations.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: By the end of the class the student will be expected to have a strong understanding of the relationship between the Buddhist Psychological framework and the related current theories from scientific Psychology.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
Exams: mid-term, final,


Students will be expected to submit questions on the readings prior to each class.
